title: Error bootstrapping latest rustc nightly with pinned stage0 compiler

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
### Hello Everyone!
*I am new to filing issues so please let me know if I did anything wrong and I can edit this post.*

**On `x86_64-apple-darwin` stage0 I get a compiler error as shown below:**

```
error: const-stable function cannot use `#[feature(const_fn)]`
   --> library/core/src/task/wake.rs:136:9
    |
136 |         clone: unsafe fn(*const ()) -> RawWaker,
    |         ^^^^^
    |
    = note: otherwise `#[allow_internal_unstable]` can be used to bypass stability checks
help: if it is not part of the public API, make this function unstably const
    |
135 |     #[rustc_const_unstable(feature = "...", issue = "...")]
    |

error: aborting due to previous error

error: could not compile `core`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
command did not execute successfully: "/Users/donaldfilimon/.rust/build/x86_64-apple-darwin/stage0/bin/cargo" "build" "--target" "x86_64-apple-darwin" "-Zbinary-dep-depinfo" "-j" "4" "--release" "--features" "panic-unwind backtrace compiler-builtins-c" "--manifest-path" "/Users/donaldfilimon/.rust/library/test/Cargo.toml" "--message-format" "json-render-diagnostics"
expected success, got: exit code: 101
failed to run: /Users/donaldfilimon/.rust/build/bootstrap/debug/bootstrap build
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:03:45
```

### More Information
I am currently on an Apple DTK *(Developer Transition Kit)* trying to cross compile `x86_64-apple-darwin` to -> `aarch64-apple-darwin`. I have successfully done this in many past rustc nightlies and this error occurred on `2020-09-28` nightly rustc. I am also using rustfmt `nightly-2020-09-28` in the stage0. This occurred in the bootstrap phase so I doubt it to be a specific issue with `x86_64-apple-darwin` or `aarch64-apple-darwin` but I could be very wrong.
